titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Pimp C rap artist collection, 1987-2008 MS 651
titlestmt.author: Trevor McNally

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-25 16:15:23 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

physdesc.extent: video concert performance footage and interview, nearline MS0651aip_001

did.abstract: The Pimp C rap artist collection includes several documents and promotional items including handwritten lyrics and contracts to promotional flats for his group Underground Kingz (UGK).

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Chad "Pimp C" Butler was a founding member of the rap group Underground Kingz (UGK) along with Bernard "Bun B" Freeman in 1987 in Port Arthur, Texas. They released their first album "Too Hard to Swallow" in 1991. In 2000, they were nominated for a Grammy for Best Rap Performance by a Duo or Group for "Big Pimpin" with Jay-Z. In 2002 Pimp C was arrested for violating his probation, stemming from an aggravated assault charge, and sentenced to eight years in prison. On December 30, 2005, Pimp C was released from prison and placed on parole. By July 11, 2006, he released his first solo album "Pimpalation." He reunited with Bun B and by 2007 released the first UGK album since his release from prison titled "Underground Kingz." Pimp C passed away in his hotel room on December 4, 2007. After his death Bun B released the final UGK album "UGK 4 Life," in which most of the recording was finished before Pimp C's death.

See online video clip "Pimp C: Real Legends Live On" at https://youtu.be/fr1XJDtGLdo. "In this mini doc shot in 2017 for Pimp C's posthumous induction into the CERCL Hip Hop Archival Collection at the Woodson Research Center in Rice University's Fondren Library, some of hip hop's royalty speak on the influence Chad Lamont 'Pimp C' Butler had on them and the hip hop culture."

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The Pimp C rap artist collection contains several documents and other paraphenalia of the artist Chad "Pimp C" Butler. The documents include handwritten song lyrics on loose leaf paper and cardboard, papers from the Texas Department of Justice relating to his arrest for aggravated assault, a Grammy nomination, a copy of his obituary from his funeral, and a marketing plan by FM2 Radio and the joint venture deal with Universal Music Group. Also included in the collection are several forms of artwork featuring Pimp C and a 12-inch record (warped), with the songs Stop-N-Go and The Game Belongs to Me.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material must be facilitated through the Woodson Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was donated by Chinara Butler and Corey Garrett, through the Center for Engaged Research and Collaborative Learning (CERCL) at Rice University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Pimp C rap artist collection, 1987-2008, MS 651, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Please see the dissertation by Charles Clark III "The Birth of Country Rap Tunes" ML3531.C62 2019. To see his accompanying presentation, you can request access to digital object MS0651aip_002.

did.unittitle: Unfinished song lyrics (Tennessee Texas), Untitled handwritten fragment beginning "Everythang everythang when you know yo place"; Notebook of lyrics, Lyrics on cardboard

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series contains unfinished lyrics from Tennessee Texas on pieces of loose leaf paper, lyrics written on a piece of cardboard, and a wide-ruled notebook with several pages of lyrics written on them.

did.unittitle: Marketing Plan by FM2 Radio & UGK Records Inc. with Universal Music Group joint venture deal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Strategic marketing plan put forth by FM2 Radio including a contract from Provident Financial Management who handledthe financial planning and management of Chad Butler's career and estate. Also included is the joint venture deal betweenUGK Records Inc. and Universal Music Group.

did.unittitle: Series III: Texas Department of Criminal Justice Papers
Special Conditions and Temporary Travel Permits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Forms from the Texas Department of Criminal Justice including: notice of special conditions (urinalysis monitoring) and temporary travel permits to Atlanta, GA; Jackson, MS; Nashville, TN.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Obituary from the funeral service of Chad "Pimp C" Butler held in Port Arthur, TX.

did.unittitle: The Source Magazine (R.I.P. Pimp C cover)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of the February 2008 edition of The Source magazine. The magazine features Pimp C on the cover and features an article about the life of Pimp C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Credit card style business cards for Pimp C, includes an email address and MySpace information.

did.unittitle: Naked Soul of Sweet Jones Spreadsheet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Spreadsheet of the song list from the album Naked Soul of Sweet Jones which was released posthumously by Pimp C on October 5, 2010.

did.unittitle: Stencil drawing of Pimp C, framed

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Framed stencil drawing of Pimp C

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Promotional flats for Underground Kingz Dirty Money (x2)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Grammy nomination certificate for Underground Kingz (UGK) for best rap performance by a duo or group for "Big Pimpin" (with Jay-Z) for the 2000 Grammy Awards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Resolution signed by Mayor Deloris Prince of Port Arthur in 2007 after the death of Chad "Pimp C" Butler.

did.unittitle: "Long Live the Pimp" dice (clear acrylic, with white ink)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 12-inch record (warped) of Stop-N-Go and The Game Belongs To Me by Underground Kingz (UGK). The record was intended for promotional use only and has clean, dirty, and instrumental versions of both songs.

did.unittitle: Series VII: Concert performances and interview
Underground Kings interview in Baton Rouge 1996 and concert in Houston TX 2007 (filename: ugkint'96&concert'07.mov)

dao.xlink:title: Pimp C concert performances and interview

daodesc.p: Pimp C concert performances and interview: 1996-2007

odd.head: General
odd.p: 1996 interview of UGK in Baton Rouge and a concert in Houston TX 2007
Interview 0:00 to 4:45. good sound quality, seems to stop in mid interview and cut to concert.
concert 4:46 - 12:06. concert footage does not have sound

did.unittitle: Underground Kings and Jay Z performing Big Pimpin at Los Magnificos Custom Car Show in Houston, TX 1999 (filename: bigpimpinlive'99.mp4)

dao.xlink:title: Pimp C concert performances and interview

daodesc.p: Pimp C concert performances and interview: 1996-2007

odd.head: General
odd.p: 1999 performance of Big Pimpin - UGK and JayZ performing Big Pimpin at Los Magnificos Custom Car Show in Houston, TX. Video shows performers onstage, sound includes the crowd more than the performers. 3 minutes, 5 seconds in duration.
